questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Exotoxins are secreted inside of the cell.
questions.explanation: False. Exotoxins are toxic proteins secreted by bacteria into their surroundings, outside the bacterial cell.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Exotoxins can be grouped into two categories, Invasins & Pyrogenic exotoxins.
questions.explanation: True. While there are multiple ways to classify exotoxins, one functional grouping distinguishes between invasins that help bacteria spread and pyrogenic exotoxins that cause fever.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Streptokinase can digest blood clots and move through tissue.
questions.explanation: True. Streptokinase is an enzyme that dissolves blood clots, which allows the bacteria that produce it to spread from the initial site of infection.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Scarlett fever is a systematic inflammation of a circulating exotoxin.
questions.explanation: True. Scarlet fever is caused by the circulation of a pyrogenic exotoxin from Streptococcus pyogenes, leading to a widespread inflammatory response and characteristic rash.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A super antigen is an antigen that is able to directly stimulate helper T cells.
questions.explanation: True. Superantigens cause a massive, non-specific activation of T cells by directly linking T-cell receptors and MHC molecules, leading to a cytokine storm.
